name: Electrode

abilities.name: Buzzap
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it to 1 of your other Pokémon. If you do, choose a type of Energy. Electrode is now an Energy card (instead of a Pokémon) that provides 2 energy of that type. This power can't be used if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electric Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrode does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

strengths: Buzzap provides instant 2 energy of any type
Can power up any Pokemon type
weaknesses: Buzzap Knocks Out Electrode - gives opponent a prize
synergies: Computer Search - Find Electrode when needed
counters: Prize denial strategies - Buzzap gives up a prize

competitiveHistory: Electrode's Buzzap was a unique energy acceleration option. While it sacrificed a prize, the ability to instantly provide 2 energy of ANY type made it versatile. It saw play in decks needing quick energy acceleration despite the prize cost.

rulings.ruling: When you use Buzzap, Electrode is Knocked Out and counts as a prize for your opponent.
Electrode becomes an Energy card providing 2 energy of the chosen type. It is no longer a Pokemon.
If the Pokemon Electrode is attached to is Knocked Out, Electrode (as Energy) goes to the discard pile.
You choose the energy type when you use Buzzap. It cannot be changed later.
